name: Hen-Dy Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent a week stopping in room 7 which was fabulous, amazing views, well equipped, good hospitality tray (with chocolate biscuits, yummy), comfy bed, lovely and warm and spotlessly clean (you usually find some dirty corners in a hotel room but not this one). David and Louise are perfect hosts and made us very welcome. The food is excellent, fresh and well cooked. If you want to eat out elsewhere (they didn't do evening meals every night because of the lack of demand) there are several very good restaurants just around the corner which were recommended by Louise and proved to be excellent (The Queen Victoria and The Seahorse). The tram terminal for The Great Orme is within walking distance (as is the pier) and we were able to park at the back of the hotel for the first couple of days so could just leave our car and explore Llandudno. The car park at the back of the hotel is very small and other days we decided to park on the promenade by the hotel. This wasn't a problem when we were there although I can imagine that it would be in the height of the summer months. You couldn't park for more than 60 minutes between 10.00 am and 4.00 pm but if we went out for the day that wasn't a problem as we usually got back around 4.00 pm. Otherwise you could park further down the promenade and just pay for over 4 hours parking (£1.50 in October).
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very impressed by Llandudno. It is very well presented, nothing tatty about the place and everyone was so friendly.
reviews.title: Simply Perfection

reviews.text: We would definitely recommend this hotel. The location is perfect. Lovely to be near the shops and pier. The Great Orme tour bus stop is almost opposite and well worth a trip (£5 for an hour's tour). But most important of all a special thank you to David and Louise for making us so welcome and our stay so enjoyable.
reviews.title: fantastic- excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From: Ann and Merfyn Evans Abermorddu
reviews.title: Great hotel with AMAZING hosts!

reviews.text: Thanks once again to Louise and David for providing us with another thoroughly enjoyable three day stay.
reviews.title: welcome to Fawlty Towers without the humour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you so much for a wonderful few days at your hotel! The hotel was spotless, the food magnificent and nothing was too much trouble for David & Louise.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Sheila & I feel privileged to have stayed ther!
reviews.title: A fantastic, friendly home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had a fabulous week at the Hen-Dy Hotel. Louise and David were fantastic hosts and their staff were very friendly and polite. Nothing was too much trouble. Rooms are spotless and comfortable (a home from home). Meals were fresh, cooked to perfection and varied daily. (forget the diet!) Will definatly be going back!
reviews.title: Simply The Best !!!

reviews.text: Kath, Dave and Lucy
reviews.title: In one word....lovely!

reviews.text: Brierley Hill, West Midlands
reviews.title: v. clean and friendly hotel, suitable for any age and I would recommend it to anyone!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As frequent travellers to llandudno and having tried quite a few hotels and B&Bs when we came across the hen-dy we thought this was everything that we wanted from a hotel so needless to say we now don`t stay anywhere else in llandudno.Louise and David are superb hosts and go the extra mile and up to yet anything my wife and i have asked for they have gone out of there way to make our stay perfect even making sure we get parked as soon as we arrive.The food is superb and plenty of it and seeing that i am a`6ft 4 man i take some feeding but have never left the dining room feeling hungry.The bar is well stocked and reasonably priced , we never fail to have a great night laughing and joking with the hosts and other guests ( even on the spontaneous hawaiian night ). So to sum up great hotel, great hosts and lots of people returning to stay speaks for itself.
reviews.title: OUR SECOND HOME

reviews.text: In late August my great grandparents went for a weeks holiday at the Hen-Dy Hotel in Llandudno. During the week my parents, sister and myself went for day to see them. We didn't stay overnight or anything but in the evening we had a lovely meal in the downstairs restaurant with them. we thought that the hotel room that my great grandparents were staying in was very nice, the lounge and bar area was a very nice size, with good decor. The restaurant was also really nice, with good seating arrangements and soft music playing in the background. The staff were really nice, only met Louise to talk to, but from what my granparents said, the other staff seemed really nice, pleasant and helpful as well. Even though we didn't stay, it was just a days visit, i would definately recomend the hotel! Anyone who doesn't recomend it must be very difficult to please! :) :) :)
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel!!!

reviews.text: PS. We also went last September, with the meal in the evening, and thought exactly the same of it!
reviews.title: lovely place and a fab breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a trip to Llandudno on the spur of the moment. With help from Tripadvisor, I contacted the proprietor about availability and he came back to me superquick. We booked the room for 3 at the back and it was a nice room. The bed was really comfy and everything was really clean and tidy.
reviews.title: First stay in North Wales hotel was excellent

reviews.text: The hosts were friendly and attentive without being too OTT.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed for a midweek break at the hen dy we booked the b n b(to call it a hotel is a joke) upon reading the reviews on this site and as such were expecting far far more, the decor is very dated and the food is poor (eg a minute piece of preformed fish, if you order fish at a seside resort you could at least expect a fillet of fish, the trifle was what i can only desribe as a bowl of slush and bares not one bit of semblence to any trifle we have ever seen we found the owner louise to be very stand-offish and unhelpful the stairs at the hen dy are horrendous as to are the stairs down to the tiny,gloomy dining room the car parking is poor down a tiny unsecure back alley and can only accomadate 4 cars at maximum as i said in my title all of the meals and breakfasts we had were cold and we were some of the first guests down at meal times we were told by louise on arrival that our choice of evening meals were required by 2 pm however be aware that upon going upstairs from the dining room after breakfast louise will be lurking annoyingly at the top of the stairs asking what you want for evening meal some 9 hours before its time this is really rude and after all how many people wish to order that early on much depends on how the weather goes and appetite etc please look elsewhere for over £50 per person per night the place is vastly overpriced there are many many more better places in llandudno available cheaper or only slightly more expensive we are not serial moaners and genuinelly believe in praising good service but we felt the hen dy was very very poor .
reviews.title: FOOD AS LUKEWARM AS RECEPTION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you David and Louise for your kind hospitality - both were welcoming and always on hand to assist if need be. It was so wonderful to come home from a busy day of sightseeing to our lovely, comfortable room. Breakfasts were served punctually and always hot - choice of both cold and hot breakfasts were very tempting. Room 6 was immaculate and standards of cleanliness excellent through out the hotel. The hotel is situated right on the seashore by Llandudno Pier and is in close proximity to all touristy attractions - especailly those on the Great Orme.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: Our only problem was finding parking but that is not really an issue the Hen-Dy can do much about.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Llandudno
Fantastic food, fantastic welcome
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 night break with our 2 young daughters. The family room on the 3rd floor is fantastic for families. It is a suite with 2 bedrooms, so children can have their own room and the parents are just next door, but still in the same overall room. Both rooms have TV's and the kids room has drinks/biscuits, which the girls loved.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is absolutely fantastic - the best we have ever had in the UK or abroad. The owners are very accomodating and make you feel very welcome.
reviews.title: Great welcome

description: The Hen-Dy is situated on the seafront opposite the pier in Llandudno. We offer bed, breakfast and evening meals. We have a small carpark and bar.
